titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Montana Interscholastic Editorial Association Publications 1957-1975
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hannah Soukup

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Kellyn Younggren 2015

repository.corpname: University of Montana-Missoula Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: The Montana Interscholastic Editorial Association (MIEA) publications collection contains materials from the MIEA spanning from 1967 to 1975 including copies of the annual handbook and the association’s newsletter.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Montana Interscholastic Editorial Association (MIEA), one of the oldest state high school press associations in the United States, was founded on May 14, 1915 during the University of Montana’s 12th Annual Interscholastic Meet. The School of Journalism’s Dean, Arthur L. Stone, and the Montana Chapter of Sigma Delta Chi, a journalism honor society, invited high school newspaper editors to attend the meet for the purpose of forming a state-wide press organization. The organization was active during the 1915 and 1916 school years, but suspended its activities during World War I. In 1923, high school journalism students, instructors, and the School of Journalism formally founded the MIEA. By 1957 the school had begun hosting High School Day, an annual conference for MIEA members with press-related workshops and awards for outstanding Montana high school journalists. The MIEA was later renamed the Montana Journalism Education Association (MJEA). As of 2015, more than 100 MJEA members attended the High School Day event each year.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of newsletters, handbooks, and pamphlets. It includes copies of the annual MIEA handbook, which was prepared jointly by the University of Montana School of Journalism and MIEA and served as a directory of publications and publication advisors at Montana high schools. The collection also contains copies of the MIEA newsletter, The Editor, from 1957 to 1975 which was published several times during the school year. The MIEA advisor, often a faculty member of the Journalism School, served as editor of the newsletter.

arrangement.p: The collection is organized alphabetically by publication title then chronologically.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright status unknown.

prefercite.p: Montana Interscholastic Editorial Association Publications, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: Materials from this collection were removed from the Archives' University Publications collection (UPUBs) during reprocessing and placed in their own collection.

accruals.p: There are no expected additions to this collection.

processinfo.p: The materials in this collection were filed with the Archives' University Publications (UPUBs) collection until 2016. Duplicates were not retained.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

controlaccess.corpname: University of Montana (Missoula, Mont.: 1965-1994). School of Journalism.
